B.R Ambedkar Hall of Residence takes the pleasure of inviting everyone to attend Basanta Panchami, to mark the beginning of spring on 1st February 2017. They are organizing a folk art exhibition of Patachitra to celebrate this auspicious day. Four artisans have been invited from Pingla to showcase their artwork. Interested visitors can participate in the workshop program which will be conducted during the exhibition. The main aim of this program will be to provide a platform to the artisans to showcase their artwork and encourage interaction between the art enthusiasts.

In the series of Know Your Professor, this time we are going to tell you about one of the most loved professors in IIT KGP, who is very close to his students as well as his alma mater. Professor Navtej Singh, an alumnus of the same institution where he has been serving as a professor for last 32 years, has spent 46 years of his life in this campus. Presently, he is delivering his services as a professor at Aerospace Engineering Department, IIT Kharagpur.
Read the full KYP here: http://awaaziitkgp.org/navtej_singh.php#

According to an analysis by British software firm Sage, the IITs are among the best in the world at churning out founders of unicorns—i.e. privately-held startups valued at $1 billion or more. US-based Stanford University claimed the top rank with 51 unicorn founders, followed by Harvard University with 37. The University of California came third with 18 unicorn founders and IITs came fourth with 12 founders. The horde of entrepreneurs coming out of IITs has caught everyone’s fancy. And we hope that we are going to see more of these in coming years!
https://qz.com/896280/most-unicorn-founders-in-the-world-are-graduates-of-stanford-harvard-and-the-indian-institutes-of-technology-iits/

National Entrepreneurship Awards | Online competition

The National Entrepreneurship Awards have been instituted by the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship (MSDE) to encourage a culture of entrepreneurship across the country. These premier awards seek to recognise and honour entrepreneurs and entrepreneurship ecosystem builders for their outstanding efforts.

The awards are going to be organised on 30th January 2017 and as a part of the awards an online competition has also been launched. As a part of the competition, all the budding entrepreneurs are requested to share their ideas on the Facebook Page and Twitter page of the Awards with the #iCanDoBusiness. The idea can be in any form - a short video in the form of an elevator pitch or an infographic. The best ideas would be recognised by MSDE.

For more information, see the brief notes attached

GC 2016-17 || Sports & Games ||  Inter Hall Cricket
RK vs Nehru
RK- 133/4 (20 Overs)
Nehru- 114/10 (19.2 Overs)
In the exciting league match of inter-hall cricket played today, RK defeated Nehru by 19 runs. Vishwajit Ekka from RK Hall scored 44 runs while being not out. In the 19th over, Shashi Bhushan from RK hall showed an amazing game by giving 0 runs and taking 3 wickets which ensured the victory on Nehru Hall. Abhishek Pandey from Nehru scored a half century (57 runs) but was not sufficient in the end. 

After the league matches, the following are the teams qualified for the Super 6:- 
Group 1: RK, RP and Azad
Group 2: Patel, LBS and MS 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur Congratulates RK Hall for this victory and wishes all the best to the qualifiers for their future endeavours.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 17 new photos.
message: IIT Kharagpur saw a warm celebration of 68th Republic Day of the nation on 26th January 2017. The flag was hoisted by the honourable Director of the institute, Professor Partha Pratim Chakraborty. The director addressed the KGP Community and gave the message of peace and harmony. It was followed by the parade and march past performed by the wings of National Cadet Corps. Marvellous performances by school children depicting culture and diversity of the nation were observed.

गणतंत्र दिवस लोकतंत्र में हमारे अधिकारों और कर्तव्यों के संतुलित होने का संदेश देता है और हमें  लोकतंत्र में अपने अधिकारों का आनंद लेने के साथ ही अपने कर्तव्यों को पूरी निष्ठा से निभाने के लिए जागरूक करता है | यह गणतंत्र दिवस आपके जीवन में खुशहाली, शांति और सफलता लेकर आए।  आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से आप सब को गणतंत्र दिवस की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएँ।

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
~ "Ek Kadam Swachhata Ki Ore"
A day back, Purvodaya in association with its media partner Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had presented Swachh Bharat Abhiyan at Kharagpur Railway Station which was attended by DRM, ADRM, CMO of the Kharagpur railway.
On the occasion of this 68th Republic Day, let's take a pledge that we will remain committed towards cleanliness and devote time for this.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added an event.
message:
Remember the times when you loved going to your grandparents’ village in your childhood? The place to where some of your funniest and fond memories belong to. Feeling Nostalgic? Don’t worry. Panch Parmeshwar is all set to drive your nostalgia away bringing to you some of those funny and interesting situations which you encountered in your village. 
Panch Parmeshwar is a fun event in which two teams are provided with a slightly complex & funny case [Depicting a situation of a village] to fight on verbally in front of the panchayat of the village. The team presenting more funny and relevant arguments is decided to be the winner.
Date: 10:00AM
Time: 21-01-2017
Veunu: In front of HSS department, IIT Kharagpur

The Inter Hall Hindi Dramatics Competition, General Championship Social and Cultural saw fascinating performances by different halls to compete for the podium finish which spanned over 2 days. Here are the results-

Gold - NEHRU HALL
Silver - AZAD HALL
Bronze - SN HALL

One of our alumnus Mr. Krishan Khanna of 1961 batch is visiting the campus between 19th Jan to 22nd Jan and also in between 26th Jan to 29th Jan. He is the trustee and founder of "i Watch ", a non-profit foundation which is on a mission of service "transforming India and Nation Building". Its main focus is governance and education and how it has a direct influence on the economy and employment. The focus is to highlight the latent potential of India which will be fully unleashed once the human capital of its people is fully empowered. For his works he has received appreciation letters from our late president Dr. A P J Abdul Kalam, and NIIT Chairman Rajendra S Pawar.

He has won many national and international awards in his 25 years of social service. He has put all his ideas in the book called "Transforming India" which is meant for a Mind-Set-Change of civil society.  To support his charity he wishes that every KGPian should have a copy of his book. His book will be delivered to your room if you express your interest through the google form here. 

The initial pages of the book are attached
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxlUftqjCKvQSXpJd1RFMENsR0paVVVSbU1MRXFHNXlPb3pr/view
Also a leaflet describing the activities of "i Watch", has also been attached https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxlUftqjCKvQNDVLa2F5OFJndXMzZnVXSGloSEdodVVWX1pJ/view
Book Purchase Link : https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScD4TTPcZwBtDf884KBiq1-aX49C4Pkd0amvAQXgRGl9DYHmw/viewform

In his visits to the campus, he will be available at his stalls in the spring fest and the Kshitij arena. People interested to meet him and discuss visionary ideas for the development of the nation can come over and join him in the arena.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hY5edvja64k

The Housing Infrastructure Development Corporation (Hidco) is planning to collaborate with the IIT's Centre of Excellence on Happiness to explore ideas to develop cities that would predominantly have the happiness quotient.
"Proper planning and guidelines are needed to consciously and scientifically proceed on this project. IIT-Kharagpur will send a team to conduct a survey and make an assessment to identify areas for improvement in New Town (Kolkata) to make the township a happy place to live in," an official said. 
http://www.nyoooz.com/kolkata/709372/iit-help-for-hidco-in-happy-city-project

message:
It seems that brain drain is a myth now. Not even 200 of total 10,000 students from the Indian Institutes of Technology took up positions outside India last year. Fifty students, who make up the largest contingent, will be leaving from IIT Bombay, followed by 40 from Delhi, 25 from Kharagpur, 19 from Kanpur, 13 from Madras, 17 from Roorkee and five from Guwahati as per a leading daily.
"Twenty years ago, 80% of the B.Tech. class used to go abroad. Now these numbers are very low. Compared to 20 years ago, a very small fraction of students go abroad today. This is contrary to the general perception," said IIT Delhi director V Ramgopal Rao.
Deepak Phatak, chair professor at IIT Bombay, said, "A large number of our students are not seeking jobs outside India. I conducted exit interviews and found that what students perceive is that the land of opportunity is here."
There is now a changing perception that quality jobs are available in India as well. Moreover, with global companies setting up offices in India, IITians can hope for placement here itself. For example, students can join Google in Bennigana Halli in Bengaluru instead of Mountain View, California.

'A journey of thousand miles begins with a single step'.
Taking into account the RTI filed on electricity consumption in IIT Kharagpur released from our page, we see a significant step being taken to reduce the unprecedented electricity consumption levels. An IIT-Kgp based Smart Home Management-startup Alive Homes, has provided a solution to this issue with their Smart Energy Management System which is currently being installed in few blocks of MS Hall and at few places in Nalanda too. We thank you guys to take such innovative steps for the welfare of the society.

http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/iit-kgp-hostels-to-undergo-smart-energy-automation-process-117011201343_1.html

#Poll_of_the_Week
#Relevance_of_NSS
While others wait for the weekend, most of us here at Kgp, on Saturday, wake up with the anxiety of going to some village by riding several kilometers on our bicycles. Although there are many who are enthusiastic about the NSS. 
What’s your take on this? Is this actually helping the students and the villagers or is just a duty that every student is forced to fulfill.
Visit the link below and share your opinion on the relevance of NSS.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/poll.php 
You can opt for multiple options and can also comment on the “others” option.
#Aap_ki_Raay_6

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
message:
#National_Youth_Day
Let us unite, not in lieu of our differences, but through them, into them and with them. Let we all Indians keep our diversities and differences intact, and yet come together, not in a uniformity that is dead, but in a unity that is living.....My Lord, Let My Country Awake. -  Mahamanav Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore

हमारा अतीत खो अवश्य गया है, परन्तु मेरा भारत अपने युवाओं के बल पर निश्चय ही फिर उठेगा, और ऐसा उठेगा कि दुनिया देखकर दंग रह जाएगी | - युगपुरुष स्वामी विवेकानंद

Sundar Pichai, CEO Google and Distinguished Alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, will be visiting the campus on 5th January to address the students.
Sunder Pichai had passed out from the institute in 1993 with a BTech in metallurgical and materials engineering. He then went on to pursue an MS in Engineering and Materials Science from Stanford University and an MBA from the Wharton School.
Later on he joined Google in 2004 as its vice president of product management, where he led the team working on Google's Chrome browser and operating system, before being elevated as its CEO last year.
It is an excellent opportunity for every individual to be a part of this discussion titled 'A journey back to the past to inspire the future' being held at TOAT on 5th of January.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
India today successfully test-fired its longest range indigenous inter-continental surface-to-surface nuclear capable ballistic missile AGNI-5 from Abdul Kalam Island off Odisha coast. The 17m long missile weighing about 50 tonnes and capable of carrying a nuclear warhead of 1.5 tonnes can target almost entire China and Pakistan and can even reach targets in Europe.

Proudly, India is the sixth country only after France, China, Russia, US and UK to have a nuclear missile with over 5,000 km range.

Congratulations to the entire DRDO team!

Here is the complete list of the winners from IIT KGP in various events in Inter-IIT Cultural Meet 2016, IIT Bombay.

Duet Dance:
Silver - Sagar & Sandeep

Dramatics:
IIT KGP won Silver in both Street Play (Nukkad) and One Act Play.
Dramatics Cup - IIT Kharagpur

Film and Media:
Short Film Making - Silver - IIT Kharagpur

Literary Arts:
General Quiz - Silver - IIT Kharagpur

Music:
Solo Singing - Bronze - Belormi Chattopadhyay & Brahmarshi Kar

Fine Arts:
Sketching - Gold - Arkapravo Saha
Painting - Gold - Gopinath Soren
                 Silver - Swastik Pradhan
IIT KGP won the Fine Arts cup.

Speaking Arts:
Debate - Gold - Vishal, Manav & Sankalp
Stand Up Comedy - Bronze - Devashish
IIT KGP shared Speaking Arts Cup with IIT Dhanbad.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners.

On 16th December a document was issued as a response to the students' plea and their demands. You can read the response here - http://bit.ly/deansa_response
And today, students received a mail stating -
"Institute will very sympathetically consider the request by the students and when the Deputy Director returns, the exact amount of assistance will be decided in the month of January 2017. The students are requested to pay the exact amount as has been decided and subsequently, it will be adjusted to the extent of the support given by the institute."
In response to that students organized a protest, and have sat on a hunger strike. Have a look at what students said regarding the fee hike and why student community thinks that they are not liable to pay the hiked fee as per the proposed changes.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
message: Student community mostly comprising of Research Scholars have sat on indefinite hunger strike in protest against administration's decision of HOH fee hike. They gathered in front of the main gate, have closed all the gates of the academic area and all the traffic has been stopped. Students said that they would sit there until Director himself comes to address them.

Although it’s winter but the job offers are raining here at IIT Kgp. Prof. Debasis Deb, the newly appointed chairman has done a swell job as in just 13 days 1043 students have bagged jobs, which in itself is a record.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congrats all the placed students and the CDC for such a commendable performance.
http://m.economictimes.com/jobs/1043-iit-kharagpur-students-bag-jobs-in-the-first-13-days-of-placements/articleshow/56008546.cms

The 51st edition of Inter IIT Sports Meet has reached up to its quarter-finals stage in some of the events. One would now get to see more fascinating and nail-biting contests. The respective teams are expected to get a lot more difficult situation to tackle and reach the semi-finals.

Here, we take a look at the upcoming quarterfinal matchups of IIT Kharagpur.

IIT Kharagpur would face IIT Roorkee in Women’s Badminton.
The football contest between IIT Kharagpur and IIT Kanpur would take place tomorrow.
IIT Kharagpur would play against IIT Gandhinagar for Men’s Lawn Tennis semis.
In Men’s Basketball, IIT Kharagpur would be facing IIT Mandi.
In Women’s Basketball, IIT Kharagpur would be facing IIT Delhi today.
The quarterfinals’ contest of Women’s Table Tennis tournament is scheduled to take place today.
In Men’s Table Tennis, IIT Kharagpur would be playing against IIT Jodhpur.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes good luck to all the participants.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
Demanding the roll back in the recent fee hike, a large number of research scholars gathered and marched together from gymkhana to main building covering Hall Management Centre at around 5 PM today. The March was in order to submit a petition with the signature of approximately 1100 scholars to Chairman HMC, Dean PGS & Research Scholars, DOSA (Dean of Student Affairs) and Director's Offices.

Here are the few important points of their petition
• The expenses under Hostel Establishment Charges are unjustified so it should be rolled back.
• Research scholars availing hostel facilities are not provided with House Rent Allowance so per head charge of 3174 for that purpose is not justified and they should be exempted from them.
• Research scholars, not availing hostel facilities (students staying in VSRC, G-type quarters, Zakir Hussain Apartments and outside campus) should be the exempted from the Hostel Seat Rent and Hostel Establishment Charges.

They told that the research scholars are the hardest hit section, with their limited income and effectively zero benefits, have been facing monotonically increasing fee, semester after semester.  Further, the scholars told that the hike in the fee is unethical as a substantial section of the research scholars here have to support their family using this stipend and will not be able to make ends meet if this fee hike is implemented.

HMC office has taken their petition and assured the protesters that further decisions in this regard will be taken latest by Friday midnight.

As Day 1 of the 51st edition of Inter IIT Sports Meet got over yesterday at IIT Kanpur, KGPians gave a highly promising a start to IIT Kharagpur. Day 1 saw some earlier records being broken and some new records being created.

Triple Jump :
Lokeshwar Rao grabbed the Gold Medal in the event of Inter IIT Triple Jump also broke the previous record by setting a new milestone of 13.68 metres.

Men’s Shot Put :
Abin won silver in Inter IIT Men’s Shot Put Event and brought glory to IIT Kharagpur.

Men’s Basketball :
IIT Kharagpur registered a victory over IIT Madras with a score of 47-32.

Women’s Basketball :
IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Hyderabad by 16-7.

Men’s Lawn Tennis : 
IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Jodhpur in Inter IIT Lawn Tennis Men’s Tournament.

Women’s Badminton :
IIT Kharagpur beat IIT Delhi 

Squash :
IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Roorkee by 2-1.

Women’s Table Tennis :
IIT Kharagpur scored a victory over IIT Patna.

Men’s Table Tennis :
IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Ropar in Table Tennis Tournament.

Men’s Volleyball :
IIT Kharagpur registered a victory over IIT Hyderabad.

Cricket :
IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Gandhinagar by 4 wickets in a close contest.  It was a nail-biting finish by IIT Kharagpur in the last over. Ayush and Sachin picked up two wickets each and Kaushal scored a quick 33 down the order.

800 Metres :
Jagdeesh qualified for the finals in Inter IIT 800 Metres Men’s Tournament.
Bharti and Hima have qualified for the finals in Inter IIT 800 Metres Women’s Tournament.

100 Metres :
Anand Raj qualified for the finals in 100 metres men’s contest.

Football :
IIT Kharagpur finished a draw against IIT BHU with the final score of 1-1.

Men’s Badminton :
IIT Kharagpur lost to IIT BHU by 0-3.

Women’s Lawn Tennis :
IIT Kharagpur lost to IIT Kanpur.

Men’s Hockey :
IIT Kharagpur lost to IIT BHU by 0-4.

In conclusion, it was a great day for IIT Kharagpur. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and wishes good luck for the upcoming events.

The 51st edition of Inter IIT Sports Meet was inaugurated successfully today at Kanpur. The Opening Ceremony was marked by the remarkable presence of the Chief Guest, Mr. K. K, Sharma, Chief Secretary of Delhi and also a former IAS Officer. Paralympic athletes, Devendra Jhajharia and Varun Bhati were the Guests of Honour for the ceremony. Being a javelin thrower in F46 events, Devendra Jhajharia is first and the only Indian to win two Paralympic gold medals. On the other hand, Varun Bhati has been a bronze medalist at the Summer Paralympic Games, 2016. The event witnessed the assembly of participants and contingents followed by Flag Hoisting and March Past. After the oath taking ceremony and the torch run, Dignitaries addressed the audience and the participants and encouraged the youth towards sports and wished good luck to the participants. International Hand Shadow artist, Amar Sen, and Enthrall Crew, a group of yoga and acrobat professionals entertained through their phenomenal performances. The ceremony ended with an amazing performance by the rock band, Indian Ocean.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes good luck to all the participants.

Sarandeep Singh (a Stanford Alumnus) and Aparna Saraogi(an IIT Delhi Alumnus) in partnership with IIT Delhi founded the Women Entrepreneurship and Empowerment (WEE) Foundation. They launched a 3 month accelerated programme for 30 budding women entrepreneurs. They are putting a spotlight on 5 women entrepreneurs who are part of the first accelerated batch of IIT Delhi based WEE Foundation. These entrepreneurs are building well differentiated sustainable businesses in diverse sectors.

To know more about the story, you can go to http://www.moneycontrol.com/news/features/watch-women-entrepreneurshipempowerment-program-launch_8095941.html?utm_source=ref_article

"It’s time for each of us to step up for human rights. There is no action that is too small: wherever you are, you can make a difference. Together, let’s take a stand for more humanity" - UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein

Human Rights Day is observed every year on December 10.This Day calls on everyone to stand up for someone's rights. Disrespect for basic human rights continues to be wide-spread in all parts of the globe. Messages of intolerance and hatred prey on our fears. Humane values are under attack.

We must reaffirm our common humanity. Wherever we are, we can make a real difference. We, the future citizens must exercise our rights to bring a change.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges all to take stand for rights and for more humanity.

#Fee_Hike
As notified earlier, the Hostel Overhead Charge (HOH) which is being collected from each student during semester registration has been reviewed and the total fee under this category has been increased from Rs. 8,250 to Rs. 15,800. The decision was taken by the HMC and the Students Senate including the Vice President, Gymkhana, all Hall Presidents and the Second Senate Members. The main reasons behind this hike are stated below.
 1.One of the major reason behind this hike is the 7th pay commission. As a result of which the salaries of both the HMC and contractual sweeping staffs have been increased. The salary of temporary workers has increased from Rs.278 per day to Rs.350 per day. 
2.One more reason behind this hike is the new policy of Tax and wage sharing. Currently, all students bear the cost towards salary and benefits of HMC employees and all outsourced sweeping workers. It has been decided that the salary of all private mess workers and tax on food served in private messes should as well be shared by all students so that those staying in halls with private mess are not disadvantaged.
3. There is also an increase in the HOH from 300 to 600. This amount is used to pay towards the annual maintenance of aqua guards,coolers, roti making machines, repairs of machines in mess, repair of flood lights in grounds[footer, cricket etc.] of hall, purchase of any new machines in mess, any new construction like badminton court etc and allied activities. The smaller halls were not able to cope with all of these with just a small amount of 300. Also, there is an increment in the comprehensive menu in all the halls to Rs. 95 per person. So, due to these factors, the HOH has increased from 300 to 600.

We would like to thanks Ksheera Sagar, a member of Student's senate for insights on the hike.
Keeping these things in mind, here is our 5th “poll of the week”.
“What are your views on the recent hike in the Hostel Overhead Charge (HOH) and Hall Establishment Charge (HEC)?”
We’ll be presenting the results of this poll to the administration, so do participate and let everyone know how justified it is. You can opt for multiple options and can also put your views or suggestions on the “Other” option.
Visit the link below to express your views on this hike.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_poll5 
#Aap_Ki_Raay_5

As notified earlier, the Hostel Overhead Charge (HOH) which is being collected from each student during semester registration has been renamed and the total fee under this category has been increased from Rs. 8,250 to Rs. 15,800. The decision was taken by the HMC and the Students Senate including the Vice President, Gymkhana, All Hall Presidents and the Second Senate Members.

We would like to thank Ksheera Sagar, a member of Students' Senate for explaining the increase in the fee.

"The main reason is for the increase is the 7th pay commission. The money [7950 per sem per student ] from all students is used to pay salaries of all HMC staff [297 in number] and all sweeping workers in all halls [nearly 500 in number],& to purchase all the sweeping and cleaning materials for all halls. As a result of the  pay commission, all the salaries were increased of both the HMC staff and also the contractual sweeping staff . The major chunk of the increment is due to the hike in salaries. Another component of the hike is due to the new policy of  TAX sharing and wage sharing. That means in the old policy[till now] the food tax on the food in private mess and the salary of the private mess workers in private mess were used to bear by private mess students only and also the private mess students used to bear the salary burden of HMC staff and sweeping staff as usual while the students at HMC mess use to bear only salaries of HMC staff , sweeping workers and sweeping materials. So in the policy [till now] the students at HMC mess were at an upper hand as they were not sharing any wages of private mess workers nor the HMC mess food has tax. This advantage ultimately led to the uplift of HMC meeses where comparatively good quality food is served than private messes. So according to the new policy, the tax of food in private mess will be bear by all students irrespective of HMC or private, the Mess workers salaries[HMC & private] will be bear by all students irrespective of HMC or private. and the sweeping workers salary , sweeping materials cost will be bear as usual. So the pay commission and the new policy of TAX and wage sharing makes the 7950 to 15200.

The HOH has also been increased from 300 to 600

This amount is called HOH[hall overhead fund], this is in general used to pay towards the annual maintenance of aqua guards, coolers , roti making machines, repairs of machines in mess, repair of flood lights in grounds[footer, cricket etc.] of hall, purchase of any new machines in mess, any new construction like badminton court etc and allied activities. The smaller halls with boarders strength less than 350 cannot do all the maintenance work with the HOH amount[300] obtained every sem from the students and the bigger halls with strength greater than 450 fell short in creating new facilities for their boarders like new courts, new instruments etc. So keeping all this in vision the money from 300 to 600 is increased. The HOH in every hall is controlled by warden so its allotment for maintenance and  development of the hall is entirely on the discretion of the warden.

From January 1 next year, all the canteens, stationery shops, restaurants and xerox centers inside IIT Kharagpur campus shall have Point-of-Sale (POS) machine (or the card swipe machine as it is commonly called) to facilitate the cashless transactions as a small move towards less cash economy as envisaged by His Excellency, the Hon'ble Prime Minister of the Republic of India.

A circular has been issued by the Hall Management Center (HMC) asking the shops and canteens to mandatorily have POS by December 31, 2016.

Researchers at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur have successfully developed a small device to measure the pH of any solution, with preliminary studies showing its usefulness to measure the pH of blood. Unlike the conventional approach of measuring the pH of blood potentiometrically, the device works by measuring the impedance. The device was found to have satisfactory pH sensitivity in the physiological pH range.The feat was achieved by Prof Soumen Das of the School of Medical Science and Technology, Prasoon Awasthi, Dr. Ranjan Mukherjee and Siva Prakasam.
For more information, you can visit the following link:
http://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/science/IIT-Kharagpur-scientists-develop-a-tiny-blood-pH-sensor/article16755581.ece

For more information, you can visit the following link:
http://www.thehindu.com/sci-tech/science/IIT-Kharagpur-scientists-develop-a-tiny-blood-pH-sensor/article16755581.ece

It's been 3 days since the placement session at KGP has started. On the day 1 of the placement itself, a total of 125 offers were made in 29 different companies that visited our campus on day 1 while 25 students have been shortlisted for the waitlist. Though on the second day the unnumbered of companies visiting KGP has reduced to 26 but still 128 students got offers as well. 26 companies also came to KGP on day 3, however, on the day 3, 97 offers were made.

Till day 3, a total of 83 companies (considering different profiles of companies) have visited the campus and a total of 350 offers were given with some getting multiple offers too, while 60 students made it to the waitlist.

The highest number of students got placed from the department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering is 89 while 66 students got placed from the department of Computer Science. 

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the successful students and wishes best of luck for the remaining days of placement.

message:
As Day 1 of Placement Season got over, 23 companies visited the campus that included names like Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, ITC Limited, American Express,Schlumberger Asia Services Ltd, Credit Suisse and Oracle. EXL Services and Sprinklr turned out to be the highest recruiters of Day 1, with recruitment statistics of 18 and 16 students respectively. 
In total, 127 students got placed along with 25 being in waitlist at the end of Day 1.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the placed students and  wishes good luck to the students sitting for the placements in the coming days.

In a bid to attract more international talent, the IITs for the first time are planning to hold their entrance tests in Singapore, UAE, Ethiopia and SAARC nations, except Pakistan next year to select foreign students for undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Foreign students who are selected to the Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) through JEE (Advanced) or GATE exams will have to pay an annual fee of Rs6 lakh per year. According to officials in the HRD ministry, the issue was discussed at a meeting of the IIT council and as per the decision taken the annual tuition fee has been fixed at Rs6 lakh per annum while suitable scholarships may be provided on a certain basis.

It is very heartbreaking to know that Professor Kalyan Kumar Guin, Dean of Vinod Gupta School of Management is no more with us. He suffered a cardiac arrest today evening after which he was rushed to Kolkata. Professor Kalyan joined Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur in 1990 and had served the Institute with pride.

He will always be in our prayers and may he rest in peace.

Mr. Dolores O' Riordan, Vice Precident, The Global Engagement yesterday visited the Food Processing Division of the Department of Agricultural & Food Engineering. He was accompanied by Prof. Colm O'Donnel, Principal, School of Biosystems & Food Engineering, UCD, Dublin, Ireland.
Prof. H N Mishra, Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering told Awaaz that they ratified an MoU with IIT Kharagpur on the establishment of a Food Technology and Entrepreneurship Park, Make in India initiatives on Nutrition, Food Security & Health and on Student Exchange Program. Prof. Mishra also added that while their visit to Food Chemistry & Technology Lab and the High Pressure Processing Unit, they have agreed to share and collaborate the state of the art techniques and equipment with the Department of Agricultural and Food Engineering.

In one of the country's most awaited developments in the field of science, today CERN Director General, Fabiola Gianotti, and Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission and Secretary of the Department of Atomic Energy (DAE) of the Government of India, Sekhar Basu signed an Agreement admitting India to CERN as an Associate Member. 

The Government of India still needs to notify CERN of its final approval for the agreement to enter into force.
Source - CERN

In order to increase the participation of IIT Kharagpur in various open-source programs like Google Summer of Code, Outreachy and much more, a new initiative by Kharagpur Open Source Society has been taken for the students of IIT Kharagpur to help them prepare for many prestigious open source programs.

Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) is a December-long online program where the students will get a unique experience of software development while being coached by mentors all around the open source world as well as many ex-GSoCers.

Go to http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in and register yourself. The program starts on 1st December. The program is open to all students regardless of their department, course, degree or the year. 

Also, if you want to be a mentor in the program, go to the website and host your project.

Our Professors Honoured!

Prof. Khanindra Pathak, Department of Mining Engineering, has been selected as Member, Experts Committee for Standardization of Environmental Clearance for Coal Mining & Coal Washery by the Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change, Government of India.

Prof. Rintu Banerjee, Department of Agricultural & Food Engineering, has been selected for the DPD Endowment Award by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research, Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare, Government of India.

Prof. Rajib Maity, Department of Civil Engineering, has been selected as James Rennell MoES Young Fellow by the Ministry of Earth Sciences, Government of India.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur proudly congratulates all of them

To keep pace with world standards,certain important initiatives of Railways for Research & Development have been launched. Technology Mission for Indian Railways has been set up and centres for Railway research (CRR) have been sanctioned at IIT Kharagpur, IIT Roorkee, Mumbai University, IIT Kanpur and IIT Chennai to carry out the research in various areas. This is seen as a small effort in the direction of keeping up with the world standards. Here is the link to the complete story:
http://www.business-standard.com/article/government-press-release/important-initiatives-of-railways-for-research-development-116111601442_1.html

To keep pace with world standards,certain important initiatives of Railways for Research & Development have been launched. Your father is a retired IPS. You did your Engineering from IIT Kharagpur, Masters from the prestigious Faculty of Management Studies, University of Delhi and then another MBA from the London Business School; and now you conspire forgeries defaming the institutions and your parents who have fostered you through years.
The Vijayanagar Police yesterday arrested two techies in an 85 lakhs duping case. The mastermind Abhishek Dhoreliya (An IIT Kharagpur Graduate) is still at large. Earlier, Abhishek had also been convicted in a 1.03 crore scam under the Foreign (Contribution) Regulation Act (FCRA) 2010 for fraud international transactions, a case which is still pending at the Hon'ble High Court of Delhi.

Let us remember that in "What we have become" lies "what we are made" through the sacrifices of our family, our society and of our country and her people. Money matters, but it can never be above the ethics and the integrity.
कर्मभूमि है निखिल महीतल, जब तक अपनी काया। 
तब तक है जीवन के, अणु-अणु में कर्त्तव्य समाया।।
                                         - राष्ट्रकवि डॉ श्री रामधारी सिंह 'दिनकर'

Source(s): The New Indian Express, Bengaluru City & The Hindu, Mysore Edition.

The Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) have sought Rs. 22,000 crore from the Ministry of Human Resource Development that is needed to spend over the next five years to improve their infrastructure and rise in global rankings. QS World University Rankings for 2016-17 had seen six of the IITs slump down from their positions. The money has been sought as part of Project Vishwajeet, which HRD Ministry wants to implement in order to make the IITs reach within the ranks of the top 100 universities in the world by 2018 and within the top 50 by 2020. 
The IITs targeted are Delhi, Bombay, Kanpur, Kharagpur, Madras, Roorkee and Guwahati. Of the nearly Rs 22,000 crore, IIT-Kharagpur has sought Rs 3,700 crore, IIT-Bombay Rs 2,250 crore, IIT-Delhi Rs 2,400 crore, IIT-Kanpur Rs 2,475 crore, IIT-Madras Rs 2,800 crore, IIT-Guwahati Rs 2,695 crore and IIT-Roorkee Rs 5,550 crore. The money will go into improving "research output, faculty, infrastructure and international outlook."

The word career means a person's "course or progress through life". It has proven itself to be more complex and overloaded than string theory and sure has taken away the sleep of many young people.

Carrying forward the series 'aap ki raay', the results of the third poll showcase the factors prioritized by students while choosing a career. Evidently, a lion's share of the students aren't sure about their career goals and are still exploring the possible options. A little more than one-sixth felt that running after money is the need of the hour and is fairly justified to do so.

About 18% are following their interests, ignoring factors such as job security and others whereas about 7% are blindly following the herd. Just the 1% are working on their own startup ideas and have opted out of campus placements. Another 8% have planned for higher studies including options like an MS or a PhD degree, IAS, etc. and have as well opted out of campus placements. More than 17% have an interest in two of the latter options but would still like to keep placements from the campus as a backup.

GC 2016-17 || Inter Hall Sketching ||
The event saw participants illustrating their sketching skills. Many amazing talents were depicted which turned it out to be a close competition.

The individual standings are as follows : 
GOLD : Shared between Swastik Pradhan(HJB) and Idris Islahi M (LBS) - 160 points
SILVER : Soham Ghosh (Nehru) - 148 points
BRONZE : Samya Samanta (LLR) - 147points

Hall standings sum up as follows :
GOLD : Nehru - 425 points
SILVER : LLR - 412 points
BRONZE : Azad - 404 points

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

Human rights are rights inherent to all human beings, whatever our nationality, place of residence, sex, national or ethnic origin, color, religion, language, or any other status. We are all equally entitled to our human rights without discrimination. These rights are all interrelated, interdependent and indivisible.
In our new section, we are going to introduce the various rights that we often hear about but don’t know about it in depth. Being the Voice of Kgp , Awaaz IIT Kharagpur takes this initiative as a responsibility to make you all aware about your ‘Human Rights’. We will start this section with the Right to Information, popularly known as the RTI.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_hr

Ambar, IIT Kharagpur in association with Crea, a feminist human rights organization, is going to conduct an interactive session: Pandora's Box , exploring gender in cinema with Sambuddha Banerji. It's your chance to voice out your opinions, to find the answers to questions which are otherwise labeled awkward and to be a part of an Interesting and unique conversation. 
Time and Venue : 10 AM, 12th November, Kalidas Auditorium.

It's a pleasure to announce that the students of Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law are organising the 3rd National Moot Court Competition which is to be held at the RGSOIPL department from 11th to13th of November'16.
This Third edition of NMCC has seen considerable expansion from the last, with over twenty teams from all over the country. Eminent lawyers, judges and legal professional have been invited to judge the various teams. This competition will feature the best of legal thinking and logical reasoning.  
So, you all are invited to join this program and have first hand experience of the trials of the courtroom and the intricacies of law.

On the occasion of 141st Patel Jayanti, Patel Hall launched a "Unity  Drive" which comprised of Cloth Donation(held on 3rd Nov) and Blood Donation event( held on 5th Nov) .
While the cloth donation event manifested joy among the villagers, the blood donation event resulted in a collection of 134 units of blood.

The Hall President of Patel Hall, Mr Chandra Mohan Meena  said " We are the young generation and we have to think about the social issues which our country is facing and have to find ways to work on it. "If we won't then who will?"

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates  Patel hall for successful completion of the event and also urges other halls to take such social initiative.

|| Important Notice ||
As per the orders from the Prime Minister of India, from midnight of November 8, 2016, Rs. 500 and Rs.1000 will cease to be legal tender i.e. these notes will just be papers from tomorrow.
The ATMs will not function till November 9, and in some places till November 10 too. 
 
Here’s what you need to know:  
# All banks will remain closed for public work on November 9.
# Deposit currently used notes of Rs 500 and Rs 1000 in post office accounts or banks by December 30, 2016. There will be no limit on the deposit amounts.
# Exchange old notes of Rs 500 and Rs 1000 at any bank, head post office or sub-post office by showing ID proof. The limit for this is Rs 4000 upto Nov 24.
# There’ll be a limit on withdrawal of Rs 10,000 per day and Rs 20,000 per week. This limit will be increased in the coming days.
# No restrictions of any kind on non-cash payments by cheques, demand drafts, debit or credit cards and electronic fund transfers.
# Rs 500 and Rs 1000 will cease to be legal tender from the midnight of November 8, 2016.
# ATM withdrawals will be restricted to Rs 2,000 per day till November 11, after which this limit may be increased slowly.
# For 72 hours, these places and institutions will continue to accept Rs 500 and Rs 1000 notes for payment:
--Government hospitals will continue to accept old Rs 500, Rs 1000 notes for payment.
--Railway ticket booking counters, ticket counters of government buses and airline ticket counters at airports will accept old notes for purchase of tickets.
--Petrol, diesel and gas stations authorised by public sector oil companies
--Consumer co-operative stores authorised by state or central government.
--Milk booths authorised by state governments
--Crematoria and burial grounds

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur advises the Kgp public to be on a safe side in the next two days and exchange/deposit such notes as soon as possible.
For further details see: http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/live-narendra-modis-address-to-nation/article9320548.ece

मीडिया' को लोकतंत्र का चौथा स्तम्भ माना जाता रहा है, और माना भी क्यों न जाए? जब सवाल नहीं पूछे जाएँगे तो फिर बिगड़ते काम काज को सुधारने की आवाज़ कौन उठाएगा या जब चीज़ें सही हो रही होंगी तो उसकी प्रशंसा कर उसे लोगो तक कौन पहुँचाएगा? 

कहते हैं विचारों को आप मार नहीं सकते; सही ही है| साथ ही जब तक मीडिया और पत्रकारिता का अस्तित्व बचा रहेगा तब तक ये विचार द्रुत गति से फैलते रहेंगे | आज हम ऐसे समय में जी रहे हैं जब वैचारिक असहिष्णुता आम हो गयी है और ऐसे में ज़रूरत होती है एक जागरूक, बेचैन और साहसी तबके की जो हर किस्म की नाइंसाफियों पर बेबाकी से बोले और समाज के हित में पहलुओं का विश्लेषण करे |

आज से दस वर्ष पूर्व खड़गपुर में जब ऐसे तबके की ज़रूरत महसूस हुई तब स्थापना की गयी उत्साह से लबरेज एक टीम की - 'आवाज़', जिसका उद्देश्य था कि वह कैंपस के जन जन की आवाज़ बन जाए | पत्रकारिता में विचारों की जंग होती ही रहती है; पत्रकार का काम ही है कि वो हर पहलू को दिखाए, और इन दस सालों में न जाने हमने कितने महत्त्वपूर्ण पड़ावों को पार किया, न जाने कितनी मुश्किलें झेलीं और आलोचनाएं तो समय समय पर लगी ही रहती हैं | 

खैर, आलोचनाएं इस बात का प्रतीक हैं कि हमें ग़म्भीरता से लिया तो जा रहा है, और इनसे प्रेरित होकर हम लगे रहे, और इतिहास इस बात का साक्षी रहा है कि हमने सूरत को बदलने की कोई कसर न छोड़ी | साल दर साल बीतते गए, पर अपने KGP जनता के हित में हमने हरसम्भव मदद करने की कोशिश की | GC से लेकर प्लेसमेंट्स तक- हर खबर का हर पहलू आप तक पहुँचाया गया | 

हम वैसे समय में हैं जहाँ पत्रकारिता में हाथ घुमाकर अपनी ही पीठ थपथपाने का प्रचलन बढ़ गया है क्योंकि जनमानस का उत्साहवर्धन क्षीण पड़ता जा रहा है, और हमें गर्व है हमारी टीम पर, टीम के भूतपूर्व सदस्यों पर, टीम को सतत मार्गदर्शन देने वाले शिक्षकों पर और सबसे बढ़कर आप पर, क्योंकि आप ही से तो हमारा वजूद है | हम सभी एक बार पुनः आप सभी जनों का आभार प्रकट करते हैं और आशा करते हैं कि आगे भी यह सहयोग बना रहेगा |

मीडिया' को लोकतंत्र का चौथा स्तम्भ माना जाता रहा है, और माना भी क्यों न जाए? जब सवाल नहीं पूछे जाएँगे तो फिर बिगड़ते काम काज को सुधारने की आवाज़ कौन उठाएगा या जब चीज़ें सही हो रही होंगी तो उसकी प्रशंसा कर उसे लोगो तक कौन पहुँचाएगा?

हम वैसे समय में हैं जहाँ पत्रकारिता में हाथ घुमाकर अपनी ही पीठ थपथपाने का प्रचलन बढ़ गया है क्योंकि जनमानस का उत्साहवर्धन क्षीण पड़ता जा रहा है, और हमें गर्व है हमारी टीम पर, टीम के भूतपूर्व सदस्यों पर, टीम को सतत मार्गदर्शन देने वाले शिक्षकों पर और सबसे बढ़कर आप पर, क्योंकि आप ही से तो हमारा वजूद है | हम सभी एक बार पुनः आप सभी जनों का आभार प्रकट करते हैं और आशा करते हैं कि आगे भी यह सहयोग बना रहेगा |

मीडिया' को लोकतंत्र का चौथा स्तम्भ माना जाता रहा है, और माना भी क्यों न जाए? जब सवाल नहीं पूछे जाएँगे तो फिर बिगड़ते काम काज को सुधारने की आवाज़ कौन उठाएगा या जब चीज़ें सही हो रही होंगी तो उसकी प्रशंसा कर उसे लोगो तक कौन पहुँचाएगा? 

कहते हैं विचारों को आप मार नहीं सकते; सही ही है| साथ ही जब तक मीडिया और पत्रकारिता का अस्तित्व बचा रहेगा तब तक ये विचार द्रुत गति से फैलते रहेंगे | आज हम ऐसे समय में जी रहे हैं जब वैचारिक असहिष्णुता आम हो गयी है और ऐसे में ज़रूरत होती है एक जागरूक, बेचैन और साहसी तबके की जो हर किस्म की नाइंसाफियों पर बेबाकी से बोले और समाज के हित में पहलुओं का विश्लेषण करे |

आज से दस वर्ष पूर्व खड़गपुर में जब ऐसे तबके की ज़रूरत महसूस हुई तब स्थापना की गयी उत्साह से लबरेज एक टीम की - 'आवाज़', जिसका उद्देश्य था कि वह कैंपस के जन जन की आवाज़ बन जाए | पत्रकारिता में विचारों की जंग होती ही रहती है; पत्रकार का काम ही है कि वो हर पहलू को दिखाए, और इन दस सालों में न जाने हमने कितने महत्त्वपूर्ण पड़ावों को पार किया, न जाने कितनी मुश्किलें झेलीं और आलोचनाएं तो समय समय पर लगी ही रहती हैं | 

खैर, आलोचनाएं इस बात का प्रतीक हैं कि हमें ग़म्भीरता से लिया तो जा रहा है, और इनसे प्रेरित होकर हम लगे रहे, और इतिहास इस बात का साक्षी रहा है कि हमने सूरत को बदलने की कोई कसर न छोड़ी | साल दर साल बीतते गए, पर अपने KGP जनता के हित में हमने हरसम्भव मदद करने की कोशिश की | GC से लेकर प्लेसमेंट्स तक- हर खबर का हर पहलू आप तक पहुँचाया गया | 

हम वैसे समय में हैं जहाँ पत्रकारिता में हाथ घुमाकर अपनी ही पीठ थपथपाने का प्रचलन बढ़ गया है क्योंकि जनमानस का उत्साहवर्धन क्षीण पड़ता जा रहा है, और हमें गर्व है हमारी टीम पर, टीम के भूतपूर्व सदस्यों पर, टीम को सतत मार्गदर्शन देने वाले शिक्षकों पर और सबसे बढ़कर आप पर, क्योंकि आप ही से तो हमारा वजूद है | हम सभी एक बार पुनः आप सभी जनों का आभार प्रकट करते हैं और आशा करते हैं कि आगे भी यह सहयोग बना रहेगा |

Patel Hall recently organised a Unity Drive on the occasion of Patel Jayanti. The drive was aimed at contributing to the needy and consisted of cloth donation and blood donation events.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates Patel Hall for their efforts in unifying the entire KGP to come together for social cause.
We went to the location and had an interview with the students over there. Let's see what they had to say.

#Poll_of_the_week
"What are your priorities while choosing any career?"
The placements and the intern season is at the peak of things right now in IIT Kharagpur. Considering the present scenario of the career turmoil in the minds of students here, Awaaz is conducting a poll to know exactly the problems persisting in the student's life. This poll is exclusively for 3rd, 4th and 5th years but others can participate too. Please give your 10 seconds time by participating in this poll so that we all can contribute in building a better and healthy KGP.
Participate in the poll in huge numbers so that we can have a fair analysis. You can opt for multiple options.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_poll3
#Aap_Ki_Raay_3...more to come.

Continuing the series “आप की राय”,the results of the second poll stress on the communication gap between general student community and office bearers of gymkhana.It can be seen that majority of students demand a platform to raise their problems whereas more than one-fifth felt that officials act carelessly.
Around 31% believed that it should be the responsibility of media houses to organize open house sessions with office bearers where student community could raise their interests.On the other hand,only 10% felt that office bearers are easily approachable and they behave positively.A meager 6.3% say that officials reply to their emails, calls, and messages in case of serious issues.
It is evident from the results that student community is not satisfied with the existing system and the need of the hour is to take up this issue seriously and come up with some feasible solutions.

Arghya Patra (MT/MS), a final year dual-degree student of the Department of Metallurgical and Materials Engineering has been selected for the Indian Institute of Metals Vidya Bharati Award 2016 based on his excellent academic performance.
He shall receive this prize at the inaugural function of the 54th National Metallurgists' Day, slated to be held on December 14, 2016 at IIT Kanpur.

Our Warm Congratulations to Mr. Patra.

In the backdrop of slashing of the Government funding to the institute and increase in fees for the students, IIT Kharagpur has come up with a plan called ‘Learn, Earn and Return’ to ensure a financial support system for the needy students and imbibe the culture of giving back among the KGPians to sustain regular inflow of funds. The scheme precisely tends to create a cycle of flow of funds to the institute in which the alumni will fund the study of current students who in turn will return the money manifold to the institute. Read the full article to know more about this initiative at the given link.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_ler

Carbon dioxide which may be a dangerous waste for the planet is a vital input for Tuticorin Alkali Chemicals for making soda ash. They are unable to get enough carbon dioxide which has been resolved by a six-year-old startup, Carbon Clean Solutions which was set up by two undergraduate students in 2009. The startup meant at  extracting carbon dioxide from flue gases in power plants and use it to make valuable products and even the CEO of Carbon Cleans Solutions said: “We are innovating the carbon dioxide capture so that its price is no more a constraint for conversion to products.” There are about 22 plants which have the capacity to capture around 40million tonnes per year, according to Global CSS Institute, an International member driven organisation. Aniruddha Sharma and Prateek Bumb started this startup and because of their hard work, they are able to develop proprietary solvent which could dissolve carbon dioxide and after testing, it came out that it could remove 90% carbon dioxide from fuel gases. Finally, they got Tuticorin Alkali Chemicals as their customer which is a big breakthrough for the company.

IITs are looking forward to better placements this December as compared to last year in the same month. There has been an increase of about 25%-30% in the pre-placement offers (PPOs) and the companies are eager to sign up to recruit the students. The companies that had already hired students as interns have taken the PPO route this year and are ready to recruit them full time. 
Across IITs, IIT-Kharagpur has received 150 PPOs and is inching closer to its last year's mark of 170. The institute is expecting 250 companies to arrive on campus for recruitment, which begins from December 1st. Around 1,950 students are gearing up for the placement process.
Source:- Business Insider

IITs are looking forward to better placements this December as compared to last year in the same month. There has been an increase of about 25%-30% in the pre-placement offers (PPOs) and the companies are eager to sign up to recruit the students. The companies that had already hired students as interns have taken the PPO route this year and are ready to recruit them full time. 
Across IITs, IIT-Kharagpur has received 150 PPOs and is inching closer to its last year's mark of 170. The institute is expecting 250 companies to arrive on campus for recruitment, which begins from December 1st. Around 1,950 students are gearing up for the placement process.
Source:- Business Insider

Patel Hall of Residence is organizing a Blood Donation Camp as part of its Unity Drive which was launched earlier in this week to honor Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel on his 141st Birth Anniversary. The Hall dedicates this Blood Donation Camp to their beloved senior Sagar Khurana who is no longer with us. A Cloth Donation event is already in motion as part of the drive. All interested are welcome to donate for this cause. The schedule is as follows :

Date: 5th Nov’16 (Saturday)
Time: 11.30 AM Onwards
Venue: Patel Hall Common Room

Please take note of the following-
1. Girls/Women can also participate in this camp.
2. Donors are requested to have an early breakfast at least 2 hours before the donation as it is a strict medical requirement.
3. Refreshments will be provided after the donation.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Sourabh Meena and Prashant Pundeer.
message: Recently, a new enterprise called PaperCut Notebooks has been started by IITKGP students to tackle the problems of increasing price of stationary items, especially notebooks, year after year. They are providing high-quality notebook at relatively lower cost than what is available in the market. It has been launched this week and to mark the occasion they have distributed notebooks to every student of "Jagriti Vidya Mandir", a school run by Gopali Youth Welfare Society (GYWS), on 28th October, free of cost.  Let’s wish them all the best for their future.

World Happiness Report published by the United Nations Sustainable Development Solutions Network ranks India 118th position among 156 countries in the measure of happiness. The Report reveals a significant decrease in the level of happiness of South Asian countries. Unhappiness and stress might lead to depression and anxiety, and the cases of the same could be found in the very own campus of IIT Kharagpur. World Happiness Report, 2013 demonstrates that a large amount of cases of depression and anxiety disorders occur between the age groups of 15 and 24 years. Hence, being an institute of national importance, IIT Kharagpur can play a major role in improving the current scenario and to promote science and practice of positivity for fostering meaningful life. In a belief of exploring the science behind happiness, IIT Kharagpur Alumnus, Mr. Satinder Singh Rekhi along with Director, IIT Kharagpur, Prof Partha Pratim Chakraborty brought the idea of a new course on ‘The Science of Happiness’ and planned to involve the course in academic curricula of IIT Kharagpur. So, here is the full article on "Science of Happiness" to let the world know more about the science behind happiness and the new initiative of IIT Kharagpur.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_soh

Computer Science and Engineering department of our institute in collaboration with Research, Designs and Standards Organisation (RDSO) and Service Improvement Group (SIG) of the Indian Railways has developed a tool suite for electronic railway interlocking system which prevents trains from colliding into each other. Researchers said that this project can be extended for further study to develop traffic operation plans. The Indian Railways, through RDSO, has awarded 12 research projects to IIT Kharagpur’s Centre for Railway Research and several of these project and technologies are being field tested after lab testing at IIT Kharagpur.

Here are the Route Maps of Illumination 2016. Plan accordingly so that you can be a part of this amazing celebration.

Illumination: The Light in Kgp's Night
As the entire nation is gearing up for one of the most awaited festive moments of the year ‘Diwali’, the students at IIT KGP are pouring their heart out for the preparation of their own unique way of celebrating Diwali, the tradition which they call ‘Illumination’ or just ‘Illu’. For KGP, Illu is Diwali and Diwali is Illu. For the freshers who will be going to witness this trademark celebration of Diwali for the first time, they must be feeling intrigued when they find the air buzzing with ‘illu’. They must be having such questions in their mind like what is it?, what’s so special about it?, what for our seniors are working so hard?, is that effort worth it? And all”. As the campus media body of IIT KGP, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur feels that the tale of this unique tradition must be passed on to the newcomers. So, here is this article on Illumination to let the world know about this masterpiece of KGP students where technology meets tradition.
http://bit.ly/awaaziitkgp_illu

"The greatest threat to our planet is the belief that someone else will save it"
Well, someone really took that seriously and is an inspiration to us all. At a mere age of 8 when most of us don’t even realize the miracle which we are walking on, a student of Eicher School Faridabad became conscious about the environmental crisis we are facing. The name of this young genius is Madhav Datt. He joined the environmental club in his school in standard 3. Some may find it hard to digest but yes, it was at this very early age where he became aware of the "actions" that are being taken to protect the environment. This notion got into this young mind, and with zeal and passion for changing the world and make Earth a better place. Read the Full article at http://bit.ly/jewelsofkgp

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 5 new photos.
message:
Celebrate DIWALI, Celebrate LIFE !

Diwali is an occasion to celebrate victory over defeat, light over darkness, awareness over ignorance; in one word, it is an occasion to celebrate optimism. Saamanjasya, the social club of VGSoM, IIT
Kharagpur celebrates this occasion of life every year in a very special manner, by spreading the smile on the faces of the very special children at Deesha Seema, a value education center at IIT Kharagpur for orphans. Saamanjasya takes a noble move towards filling the life of those little angels with happiness and light. They raise the funds for Diwali Celebration at Deesha Seema through T-shirt sales drive. This year, they received a really positive response to this Sales-drive from all the students of IIT, in this way you all have contributed ‘A Smile’ to an innocent face. 

Diwali is knocking the door and Saamanjasya welcomes you all to join the Diwali Celebrations at Deesha Seema and spend the evening with the very special kids. Here are some of the pics from the event.

Saamanjasya takes a noble move towards filling the life of those little angels with happiness and light. They raise the funds for Diwali Celebration at Deesha Seema through T-shirt sales drive. This year, they received a really positive response to this Sales-drive from all the students of IIT, in this way you all have contributed ‘A Smile’ to an innocent face. 

Diwali is knocking the door and Saamanjasya welcomes you all to join the Diwali Celebrations at Deesha Seema and spend the evening with the very special kids. Here are some of the pics from the event.

|| INTER HALL DEBATE RESULTS ||

As the battle for General Championship is getting intense day by day, Inter Hall debate competition was organised today in F-127. There is no need to mention that the participants left no stone unturned in giving their best as we all are familiar with the kind of zeal and enthusiasm with which students fight for the glory of their respective halls. After a very fierce competition, the individual winners were:

GOLD: Kunal Jain (LLR)
SILVER: Vishal Chauhan (RP) and Aditya Kothari (LBS)
BRONZE: Rohit Sar (Azad)

Hall standings were as follow:
1. LLR - 74.5 points
2. Azad - 72 points
3. RP - 69.5 points
4. LBS - 68 points

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners!

Researchers from our institute have achieved another milestone in their field. They have designed a software that enables those with neuro-motor disorders to access the web, play games, and participate in social networking with ease.  This disease occurs when specialist nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord called motor neurons stop working properly and eventually lead to muscle weakness, often with visible wasting. 
"For the neuro-motor disorders, we have developed the interface by which they can access web and carry out social networking activities," says Professor Anupam Basu, from the department of computer science , lead researcher and Head and Chairman, Centre for Education Technology, IIT Kharagpur.

Extending its brilliant heritage in biotechnical research, IIT Kharagpur,jointly with IIEST Shibpur and Guru Nanak Institute of Dental Sciences and Research (GNIDSR), has initiated a joint interdisciplinary research in fields of oral health care by signing a MoU on the same. This initiative aims to gather information and tackle oral cancer and pre-cancer problems the people in India face.
Already into lines of conducting stem cell research,which would range cures for many ailments, the Institute has therefore extended its arms wide for future biotechnical research in India and the world at large.
Such an initiative wouldn't only benefit the general public,but would also open doors to advanced stem cell and other research avenues in the near future.

In the era of entrepreneurship, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur sees it as its duty to share some of the successful startup stories related to IIT Kharagpur. Here, 8th in the series we present to you the story of Sachin Jaiswal, CEO of Niki.ai. He is a 2011 batch pass out from the department of Electrical engineering, IIT Kharagpur and boarder of Radha Krishnan Hall of Residence. Niki.ai was founded in April 2015 by four IIT Kharagpur alumni – Sachin Jaiswal, Keshav Prawasi, Nitin Babel and Shishir Modi. Niki.ai is a chatbot that users can ‘talk’ to. The app understands human language in the context of the products or services, which users wish to avail. So let's see what Sachin has to say about Niki.ai and his journey to CEO: http://bit.ly/AwaazKYE8
#KYE8

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with Simon Prasann and 10 others.
message:
The Weightlifting Team of IIT Kgp has emerged as overall champion after Day 2 of “SPARDHA 16”, the All India Games And Sports festival of IIT BHU. 
Results of Day2 Weightlifting events are:
56 Kg category: Biddu Bhushan Singh (Silver)
62 Kg category: Udit Narayan (Silver) 
69 Kg category: Manny Jain (Bronze)
77 Kg category: Sawai Devpal (Bronze)
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the weightlifting team. You have made us proud.
#GO_KGP 
#WE_KAN

The revamped and refurbished Kabaddi World Cup had a grand finale in Ahmedabad on Saturday night, after a thrilling final that saw hosts India produce top class kabaddi to overcome Iran 38-29. However, some things never change, and India's kabaddi supremacy is certainly one of these. Indian Side considered overwhelming favorites to lift their third World Cup, did so in emphatic fashion. However, doing so against an Iran side that played the match of their lifetimes has an astonishing feel about it.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur hereby celebrate this victory of our country in Kabaddi World Cup 2016.

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message: A candle light march was organised this evening in memory of Sagar Khurana (CSE/2013/Patel) by Patel Hall students. It started from Patel Hall via Gymkhana to Bidhan Chowk in the main building today at 6 PM. Sagar Khurana was diagnosed with cancer and pneumonia which led to his sad demise in Gurgaon. He was one of the brightest students of the 2013 batch who never refrained himself in helping out the people. He was a selfless human being and was a source of inspiration and motivation to many. The march was attended by hundreds of students. At the end of candle march a silence of one minute was observed to pay tribute to him.

For a student, internship or training matter a lot in the shaping of their career. He/She gets the opportunity to learn many things during their internships. Getting an internship opportunity in a foreign institution is the new craze among students. Almost everyone is putting his efforts to bag an FT. But many students aren't aware of the fundamentals of this and don't know what to do and how to do. To help such students, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur brings to you this article which will hopefully cater to your needs.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/ft.php?page=home

राजभाषा विभाग, भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान खड़गपुर द्वारा हिन्दी दिवस 2016 के उपलक्ष्य में प्राध्यापकों, अधिकारियों, स्टाफ और छात्रों के लिए प्रतियोगिताओं एवं कार्यक्रमों का आयोजन किया जा रहा है | ये प्रतियोगिताएं 24 से 28 अक्टूबर के बीच आयोजित होंगी | प्रतियोगिताओं में वाद-विवाद, निबंध, आशुभाषण, काव्यपाठ आदि भी शामिल हैं | आप सभी से हार्दिक अनुरोध है कि उत्साह के साथ इस कार्यक्रम में अपनी सहभागिता सुनुश्चित कराएं और इस आयोजन को सफल बनाने में अपना योगदान दें | 
अन्य जानकारी हेतु 81718, 81864 पर राजभाषा विभाग अथवा 9308591858, 9641049944 एवं 9564156315 पर संपर्क कर सकते हैं। कार्यक्रम की विस्तृत जानकारी नीचे संलग्न पोस्टर में दी गयी है |

राजभाषा विभाग, भारतीय प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान खड़गपुर द्वारा हिन्दी दिवस 2016 के उपलक्ष्य में प्राध्यापकों, अधिकारियों, स्टाफ और छात्रोंके लिए प्रतियोगिताओं एवं कार्यक्रमों का आयोजन किया जा रहा है | ये प्रतियोगिताएं 24 से 28 अक्टूबर के बीच आयोजित होंगी | प्रतियोगिताओं में वाद-विवाद, निबंध, आशुभाषण, काव्यपाठ आदि भी शामिल हैं | आप सभी जनों से हार्दिक अनुरोध है कि उत्साह के साथ इस कार्यक्रम में अपनी सहभागिता सुनुश्चित कराएं और इस आयोजन को सफल बनाने में अपना योगदान दें |

The Weightlifting Team of IIT Kgp has started Day 1 of “SPARDHA 16”, the All India Games And Sports festival of IIT BHU, on an overwhelming note with 3 medals in 2 categories. 
Results of Weightlifting events are:
85 kg category: Silver (Amal Jose)
85+(open) category:Gold (Simon); Silver (Pavan Konduri)
Events to be held on Day 2 are:-
Weightlifting for 56,62,69,77 kg category.
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur wishes BEST OF LUCK to team Kgp. 
#GO_KGP

With the utmost pain and sadness, we are informing you that Sagar Khurana (CSE/2013/Patel) is no more between us. He was diagnosed with cancer and pneumonia which led to his sad demise yesterday in Gurgaon. Sagar was a great human being of selfless nature who was always very humble in every situation that he faced. He represented Patel Hall and IIT Kharagpur in Cricket and was one of the best fast bowlers KGP has ever produced. He held a number of posts in his hall during his stay at IIT Kharagpur and was a well known Maths wiz and a tech geek in the campus. He was one of brightest students of the 2013 CSE batch who never refrained himself in helping out people. He was a guiding light, a star to whoever knew him and the reason why so many people are crying today is because above all things, he was the sweetest soul you'll come across. A heart so generous, a soul so pure and an attitude that's par excellence. We weep today because we have lost someone who was in all of us. KGP will always remember him as its sincerest and brightest student. May his soul rest in peace.

To express its deep condolences, Patel Hall is organizing a candle march today at 6 PM from PATEL HALL via Gymkhana TO BIDHAN CHOWK  in the main building. We request the entire student fraternity and faculty to attend this candle march.

Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur congratulates Team SEAL: Manaar Alam, Vidya Govindan , Sarani Bhattacharya, Debapriya Basu Roy(mentors: Rajat Subhra Chakraborty, Debdeep Mukhopadhyay) to qualify for the finals of the Ninth Embedded Security Challenge, hosted by NYU Tandon School of Engineering. 
For the first time, IIT students from India are among seven teams to have sailed through to the finals of the oldest and largest hardware hacking competition in the world. They are among the only two Indian teams who qualified for the same, the other team being from IIT Madras.
For further details : http://www.businessinsider.in/Meet-the-IITians-who-have-made-their-way-into-worlds-largest-hardware-hacking-competition-finals/articleshow/54831499.cms

In a recent meeting of IIT directors and experts on project "VISHWAJEET" that seeks to make IITs world class institute decided to modernize five laboratories each in seven old IITs. They will be made at par with the best in the world. These labs will get funding from proposed Higher Education Finance Agency, directly from government and industry. 
Project "VISHWAJEET" will aim to pick the IITs with the greatest potential to climb up the global pecking order and then ensure close focus on them, backed with funding, so that they excel on all parameters.

http://awaaziitkgp.org/ 
#AAP_KI_RAAY #1... more to come.

Are the rising numbers of mosquitoes in our campus bothering you? Well, we should be happy that institute is all prepared to help you in case you catch malaria. Researchers at Bio-medical Imaging Informatics (BMI) Lab, led by Chandan Chakraborty and his research team at the School of Medical Science & Technology, IIT Kharagpur  has developed a smartphone app that will be beneficial in the detection of malaria. The present detection and treatment methods are very time-consuming. The development of such an app and technology can help in easy and early detection of malaria. The app has been tested on more than 200 microscopic images of 80 patients and it detected the disease with more than 90%  accuracy.

Indian Institute of Science Bangalore has named second of the prestigious three Distinguished Chairs in Neurocomputing and Data Science (NCDS) after Mrs. Sudha Murty, an alumnus of IISc. Prof. Vasant Honavar, the Edward Frymoyer Endowed Professor of Information Sciences and Technology at Pennsylvania State University, is the first recipient of the Chair. The objective of this initiative is to promote high-impact collaboration leading to capacity building and ecosystem creation in the brain, computation, data, and systems.

Mrs. Sudha Murty, Chairperson, Infosys Foundation is currently serving as a member of Board of Governors, IIT Kharagpur.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is glad to congratulate Mrs. S. Murty.

Up to 10% additional seats in each Indian Institute of Technology course can now go to foreign students. The 10% intake is in addition to the existing seats available in each of the 23 IITs. Foreign students will have to take the JEE Advanced examination only and not the JEE Mains exams to qualify for a seat in IIT. For MTech courses, they will have to qualify Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE). The exams will be held in six international centers instead of just one so far. These countries are Ethiopia, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, UAE, Nepal, and Singapore. 

It has been clarified by the officials that an increased number of seats for foreign students does not mean lesser seats for Indian students.

Citing limitations of resources from infrastructure to faculty the seven older IITs namely Kharagpur,Bombay, Delhi,Kanpur,Roorkee,Madras and Guwahati have refused to increase their B.Tech seats as proposed by the government at IIT Council meeting held on 23rd August. However , the second generation IITs namely Hyderabad, Mandi, Ropar, Patna, Jammu will increase their UG seats by 40,50,25,105,30 respectively from next year onwards. The IIT Council had earlier approved increasing the student strength from 72000 to 1 Lakh by 2020.

However , the second generation IITs namely Hyderabad, Mandi, Ropar, Patna, Jammu will increase their UG seats by 40,50,25,105,30 respectively from next year onwards. The IIT Council had earlier approved increasing the student strength from 72000 to 1 Lakh by 2020.

Citing limitations of resources from infrastructure to faculty the seven older IITs namely Kharagpur,Bombay, Delhi,Kanpur,Roorkee,Madras and Guwahati have refused to increase their B.Tech seats as proposed by the government at IIT Council meeting held on 23rd August. However , the second generation IITs namely Hyderabad, Mandi, Ropar, Patna, Jammu will increase their UG seats by 40,50,25,105,30 respectively from next year onwards. The IIT Council had earlier approved increasing the student strength from 72000 to 1 Lakh by 2020.

Citing limitations of resources from infrastructure to faculty the seven older IITs namely Kharagpur,Bombay, Delhi,Kanpur,Roorkee,Madras and Guwahati have refused to increase their B.Tech seats as proposed by the government at IIT Council meeting held on 23rd August. However , the second generation IITs namely Hyderabad, Mandi, Ropar, Patna, Jammu will increase their UG seats by 40,50,25,105,30 respectively from next year onwards. The IIT Council had earlier approved increasing the student strength from 72000 to 1 Lakh by 2020.

IIT KGP students have again shown their technical prowess and have made the entire KGP community feel proud of them. This time, institute’s Aerial Robotics Kharagpur (ARK) has carved out its niche in the national arena and they have been the talk of the town for last few days. They are developing drones using indigenous hardware and software which will be capable of autonomous flight, localisation in GPS-denied environments, and tracking and interacting with mobile ground robots as well as other drones, and much more. This technology can prove to be a major breakthrough in various fields like agriculture technology, mine surveying, surveillance etc. Recently, ARK were the only team from India to participate in International Aerial Robotics Competition at Beijing (China) in September.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur applauds the efforts of the entire team of ARK and wishes them for their future endeavours.

Source: Business Standard

Interestingly, the post of the Executive Chairman of Globsyn Group is also held by an IIT KGP alumnus, Mr. Bikram Dasgupta (1973/MA/RP).

Source: The Hindu Business Line, Kolkata Metro City Edition

You may be aware of the recent communal riot in Golbazar and adjoining areas. A curfew has been imposed in those areas and police are not allowing entry of transport vehicles into godowns. As a result, supply of essential items like vegetables, milk, curd, bread, etc. is affected for the past few days.

If the situation does not improve by tomorrow then mess services would be severely affected. It may not be possible to serve vegetables, milk, bread, etc.

All the students are requested to cooperate and bear with the inconvenience for a few days. The HMC is closely monitoring the situation and would take emergency measures if necessary.
-------------------------------
 Credits - Vice-President,Technology Students' Gymkhana

Important Notice

This is to bring to the notice of people who are staying back here at the campus and those who will be coming back in the near future. Please keep yourself away from going to Gole Bazar and areas near to it for a few days as many cases of communal violence has been reported there immediately after the conclusion of Durga Pooja  which subsequently resulted in the curfew. A good number of serious casualties have also been reported. Stay connected for further updates!

Source: Campus Security

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur with Dimple Kapadia.
message: After her magnificent performance in the 64th Inter Hall Athletics Meet, the best woman athlete award winner from SN Hall, Ms. Dimple Kapadia  has something to say to the administration as well as to the student community about the declining girl participants. She has made an appeal to all for a better environment and to improve the conditions of the participation for girl athletes.

Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet || Water Polo Final

IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Kanpur with a good margin of 3 points (9-6). 

In the first quarter both the teams were equally competitive but then till the third quarter KGP dominated and score was 6-3. In the final quarter IIT Kanpur tried a comeback with 3 points but it was IIT Kharagpur who won the game 9-6.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for this Gold winning performance!

IIT Kharagpur and Infosys Foundation,the philanthropic arm of Infosys have signed a MoU in which later has agreed to fund socially relevant projects undertaken by the institute. The major projects being funding of travel (preferably for women) to 'Top International Conferences' and the funding of the much-celebrated research of the Indus Valley antiquity which IIT Kgp is carrying out in association with the Archeological Survey of India. Sudha Murty,  Chairperson Infosys Foundation iterated the importance of funding the programmes that will help in the advancement of Education and Culture and said that the foundation was committed to nurturing such programmes.With support from Infosys Foundation, 8-10 meritorious girl students will be selected by a committee at IIT KGP to be sent to top conferences.
Prof. Anindya Shankar, the lead investigator of the project "Tracking the Antiquity and Climate during Bronze Age Harappan /Indus Valley Civilization (IVC) in India Using Isotope & Latest Chronological Techniques (CVO)" feels  that funds have reached at right time to maintain the pace of the research.

GC 2016-17 ll Athletics 
Final Standings (MEN)
1. MS Hall - 84 points
2. LBS Hall - 29 points
3. Nehru Hall - 24 points
4. RP Hall - 23 points
After 2 days of rigorous effort of the participants as well as the organising members, we have finally concluded the GC Athletics 2016-17. Like the previous year, MS played according to its reputation and swept through the Athletics round. It was followed by LBS which made a grand entry into the top 3. Nehru finished 3rd improving its position from the last year.

Final Standings (WOMEN)
1. SN Hall - 48 points
2. MT Hall - 13 points
3. SAM Hall - 10 points
The Female Athletics was undoubtedly dominated by SN Hall that scored more than all other teams combined. It was followed by MT and SAM Hall.

IIT Kharagpur is going to host the quarter-finals of the prestigious Hult Prize 2017. IIT Kharagpur has been chosen as the venue along with IIT Delhi, BITS Pilani, IIM Ahmedabad and IIM Indore, where separate quarter finals will be held. 
This is to note that till 2013 only top tech and business schools of Europe and US could be venues for quarter finals. After ISB Hyderabad winning the 2014 competition made the organizers to re-think about allowing the quarterfinals to be held at Indian venues. 
To know more about Hult Prize please go through the following document: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BzVuwdGrHJWQbUZOUHpCeFFvNXc/view?usp=sharing
